content: COPENHAGEN, May 4 (Reuters) - Denmark will allocate about 38 billion Danish crowns ($5.65 billion) over the coming 10 years to upgrade its armed forces, the country's acting Defence Minister Troels Lund Poulsen said on Thursday.

The amount comes in addition to Denmark's commitment last year to permanently increase its spending on defence and security to 2% of the country's gross domestic product by the end of 2033, a key goal for NATO member states. ($1 = 6.7224 Danish crowns) (Reporting by Louise Breusch Rasmussen, editing by Terje Solsvik)
